reviews.title: Close enough to the action

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here last week for 4 nights. Didnt think it would be anything fancy as it was only a 3 star hotel, and got it pretty cheap - but we were surprised! It is worth more than 3 stars! We asked for early check in as our flight was in the morning, and when we arrived it was ready earlier than the stated time. The staff were friendly and spoke english well. The corridoors, lobby area and restaurant were all clean and tidy. The outside didnt look tacky either.
reviews.title: Cheap, colourful, friendly

reviews.text: The room was clean and tidy, and staff came in to clean everyday. There was a TV (with only 1 english channel and 1 music channel - but this didnt bother us) and a hairdryer already provided. The staff at reception also provided us with a map/guide which we used the whole time we were there. We had a power shower, and shower gel/hand wash was attached to the wall. The bed was comfy and the sheets were very soft, we slept very well (apart from the last night as noisy neighbours arrived). Room service is also available, but we didnt use this.
reviews.title: Great location and excellent staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast wasnt amazing, but it was sufficient, and you can eat as much as you want to fill you up until lunch time. There wasnt any beans/mushrooms/hash browns, so you couldnt have an english breakfast, but you can have lots and lots of pastries ;) The staff also clear your plates for you.
reviews.title: Weekend Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in quite a good area - only 15/20 mins walk into the Old Town, passing a big shopping centre on the right - great for food and FREE toilet stops! Haha. Krakow itself was a lovely place to visit and we would go again. There is also tram stops nearby, and a train station within a 10 min walk.
reviews.title: Chopin Hotel Cracow short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would have liked a kettle in the room, but other than that everything was sufficient, or more than enough.
reviews.title: Good Quality 3 star Hotel Chopin

reviews.text: We just returned from a city break in krakow, where we stayed at the Hotel Chopin for 5 nights. The Hotel is serviced by very friendly and very helpful staff. The rooms are reasonably basic, but comfortable and clean and more than adequate for the purpose. The Hotel is a little way out from the city centre, but close enough to reach with very little effort or cost. If you use the underpass out the front of the Hotel you can take the number 4 or number 10 tram into the centrum in minutes. You can also take a taxi ( the hotel will happily call you one) which is also very inexpensive ( about 4/5 pounds). You can also take a lovely 15 minute stroll down Lubicz street which can also be reached by using the underpass in front of the Hotel.
reviews.title: A very enjoyable stay and exceptional value.

reviews.text: The Hotel serves an exceptional breakfast, and the quality of food is fantastic. We only used the restaurant once, but each of us had a beautifully presented and delicious meal. The Hotel also has a great bar facility, which at the end of a day packed with sightseeing was very much appreciated. The bar also does bar snacks/ meals. Instead of booking our trips with coach companies, we chose instead to use the private driver service that is available from the Hotel. The driver is a very lovely Polish gentleman called Tony (Antoni). The cost of the private hire was minimally higher than a coach trip and instead of being told when to get off and on and when to be back, Tony waited at our daily destination , and we left when we were ready. Tony was ver helpful on arrival to attractions by taking you directly to the ticket counter and entrances and on occasions performed a couple of cheeky queue jumps, and on one visit managed to get us onto a ready to leave smaller guided tour. Tony was lovely, friendly, good fun and definitely enhanced our experience. If you get the chance, I highly recommend a day trip to Zakopane, which is the winter capital, and breathtaking in summer. And of course Auschwitz and the Sat Mines are an absolute must. We personally would also recommend the Schindler factory / Museum. It is more about the Jewish Quarter and the Jewish people during the time of the holocaust, and visually brilliant and informative. We thoroughly enjoyed every bit of our trip o Krakow and the Chopin was a perfect and welcoming base. We thoroughly recommend the Hotel Chopin to everybody.
reviews.title: Krakow Trip

reviews.text: Recently stayed at Chopin Hotel, Krakow.The staff were friendly and helpful.we had a twin room and where it was adequate for our needs it was a bit cramped with the two single beds quite close,also the air con was a big miss.
reviews.title: Deserves More Than 3 Stars

reviews.text: Just returned from 3 nights in the Chopin Hotel. Have no complaints about this hotel, I would certainly say it deserves more than 3 stars. Rooms are on the smallish size but was only in the room to shower & sleep so no problem. Although near main roundabout, I didn't hear any noise from the traffic. Nice decor, clean, really comfortable beds! Had tea & coffee facilities in the room. Hotel itself is clean and nicely decorated. All staff were friendly. Only ate breakfast in the restaurant, didn't have any other meals. Breakfast was good - self service with choice of fruit, cereals, ham, cheese, pastries, toast, egg, bacon, sausage, etc. Hotel is in a good location, next to tram junction, only took 5/10 mins on the tram into the centre or a leisurely 20/30 minute walk. Taxi back from the main square only took 5 minutes. Would recommend this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Short break to a great city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a three night break. All the the staff were very helpful and friendly. Not a very big room, but a nice modern and clean room, breakfast was a mix of hot items and also a choice of continental style items. We found this good and it saves time going out having to look for a place that serves breakfast. It also has a nice bar area that was good to have a few beers in before going into town. It takes about fifteen minutes to walk in to the town, you also pass a few bars and a big shopping centre on the way. The hotel is very good value for money, we booked it as a package with easyjet, got a very good deal. Krakow is a very good city to get round and is still cheap for food and drinks. We will go again and stay at this hotel when we do.
reviews.title: A very pleasent hotel to stay in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned today from a wonderful trip to Krakow. I must admit I was unsure what to expect of our Hotel (part of a short break booked through Travel Republic) expecting a taste of old Soviet basic accommodation but how wrong. The hotel felt very modern, clean, bright and cheerful room decor, friendly staff and a good selection for breakfast. If I was to find a fault it would be that it is about 15 min walk to the station and old town but we love to walk so that wouldn't put us off and there are tram stops right outside which will take you in for about 50p.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While were on the subject of money, cost of living is still well below ours so our spending money went much further than we expected.
reviews.title: LOCATION & VALUE GREAT

reviews.text: Krakow old town is one of the prettiest places you will ever see. Lots of different eating places, many with amazing settings. The square is a great place to sit and have a beer. Although dearer than elsewhere, £2.50 a pint is still amazingly cheap, especially with views and an atmosphere that would rival St. Marks Sq, in Venice.
reviews.title: Super clean modern Hotel to explore Krakow from
Fab stay at Hotel Chopin
reviews.text: We were there from Monday - Thursday which was lively in a good way but I think we may avoid the weekends and Stag and Hens doos.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just one point to note which is well worth knowing, with the trams you buy a ticket either at the kerb side or on the tram then validate it when you travel. We were buying a ticket on a tram when we realised we were on the wrong one. Not a problem as you can use the ticket for all trams. We didn't have time to validate it before we jumped off to walk back to our starting point to catch the correct tram. We were immediately stop by a so called tram inspector you wanted to fine us for not validating our ticket. He was very intimidating, and within seconds his colleague joined in the debate. We held our ground and asked to be taking to the police station where we felt they would have more common sense. They agreed, but after a short walk told us it was our 'lucky day' and let us go. We felt it was a scam to make us pay them. Who know's.
reviews.title: Good location, clean hotel.

description: The 3-star Chopin Hotel is located in the centre of Cracow, opposite the Cracow Opera and in walking distance to shopping and financial centres, the Central Railway Station and the Old Town. Easily accessible by public transport or by car, the hotel is the perfect choice for city tourists and business travellers. All rooms are air-conditioned and equipped with wireless internet access, prices include breakfast buffet and free entry to the fitness studio.
